body.header: Questions 4-9. Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Click the correct letters A-C.

section.ol: 4How many people have VWI sent abroad to work?a.nearly 21,000b.21,000c.more than 21,0005Where do VWI volunteers come from?a.The USA and Canadab.The USA and Europec.Canada and Australia6How old is the oldest volunteer?a.65b.66c.707What are volunteers in Vietnam doing?a.training teachersb.teaching Englishc.teaching primary school children8Where are volunteers in South Africa working?a.in the citiesb.in the countrysidec.in both the cities and the countryside9Who are volunteers in Thailand training?a.healthcare workersb.youth workersc.park workers

section.p: 1. James says they've sent over 21,000 and over means the same as more than.
2. James says that most of their recruits are from European countries and the United States.
3. James says that most of their volunteers are younger but that they do have one or two between the ages of 66 and 70.
4. James says that their biggest projects in Vietnam is in English language teacher training and primary teacher training.
5. James says that volunteers work in rural communities in South Africa.
6. James says that the volunteers go to national parks and wildlife sancturies and conduct staff training.
